perturbation.original_text: This Sponsorship Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of December 18, 1998, by and between Ford Motor Media, a division of J. Walter Thompson ("FMM") with offices at 300 Renaissance Center, Detroit, Michigan 48243 and iVillage, Inc., ("iVillage") with offices at 170 Fifth Avenue, New York, New York 10010. FMM and iVillage may be referred to generically as a "Party", or collectively as "Parties".
perturbation.changed_text: This Sponsorship Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of December 18, 1998, by and between Ford Motor Media, a division of J. Walter Thompson ("FMM") with offices at 300 Renaissance Center, Detroit, Michigan 48243 and iVillage, Inc., ("iVillage") with offices at 170 Fifth Avenue, New York, New York 10010. FMM and iVillage may be referred to generically as a "Party", or collectively as "Business Associates".
perturbation.explanation: Changing the collective term from 'Parties' to 'Business Associates' introduces ambiguity. While 'Party' is defined, 'Business Associates' is not, potentially leading to confusion about the legal roles and responsibilities of FMM and iVillage.

perturbation.original_text: In the event of a material breach by either Party of any term of this Agreement, the non-breaching Party may terminate this Agreement by written notice to the breaching Party if the breaching Party fails to cure such material breach within thirty (30) days of receipt of written notice thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event of a material breach by either Party of any term of this Agreement, the non-breaching Entity may terminate this Agreement by written notice to the breaching Organization if the breaching Organization fails to cure such material breach within thirty (30) days of receipt of written notice thereof.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'Party' with 'Entity' and 'Organization' introduces inconsistency. While 'Party' is initially defined, 'Entity' and 'Organization' are not, creating uncertainty about who is subject to the breach and termination clauses.

perturbation.original_text:
All notices, requests, demands, payments and other  communications which are required or may be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given if delivered personally, telecopied or sent by nationally recognized overnight carrier, or mailed by certified mail, postage prepaid, return receipt requested, as follows:

         If to FMM:

                             Ford Motor Media                              500 Woodward Avenue                              Detroit, Michigan 48226-3428                              Attention:  Carol Wright                              Tel: (313) 964-2954                              Fax: (313) 964-2315

         If to iVillage:

                             iVillage, Inc.                              170 Fifth Avenue                              New York, New York 10010                              Attention: Vice President Business/Legal Affairs                              Tel: (212) 206-3106                              Fax: (212) 604-9133
perturbation.changed_text:
All notices, requests, demands, payments and other  communications which are required or may be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given if delivered personally, telecopied or sent by nationally recognized overnight carrier, or mailed by certified mail, postage prepaid, return receipt requested, as follows:

         If to FMM:

                             Ford Motor Media                              500 Woodward Avenue                              Detroit, Michigan 48226-3428                              Attention:  Carol Wright                              Tel: (313) 964-2954                              Fax: (313) 964-2315

         If to iVillage:

                             iVillage Company                              170 Fifth Avenue                              New York, New York 10010                              Attention: Vice President Business/Legal Affairs                              Tel: (212) 206-3106                              Fax: (212) 604-9133
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'iVillage, Inc.' to 'iVillage Company' creates uncertainty about the correct legal entity to contact for notices. This discrepancy could lead to legal complications if notices are misdirected or deemed improperly served.
